channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SNAP benefits must be fully paid by Trump administration by Friday, judge orders
item.description: The Trump administration recently said it would not pay any SNAP benefits, but then offered partial funding of the food stamp program after a judge's ...

item.title: SNAP update: Trump admin will pay 50% of food stamp benefits in November amid shutdown
item.description: The agreement to use contingency funds to pay for food stamp benefits came after a judge said Trump administration could not cease paying for the bene...

item.title: Senate Republicans reject Democrat deal to reopen government
item.description: The U.S. government shutdown has dragged on for 38 days because of a dispute over whether ACA tax credits should be included in a stop-gap funding bil...

item.title: Trump suggests U.S. won't pay any SNAP benefits during shutdown, contradicting court filing
item.description: Prior presidential administrations have continued paying SNAP benefits during past shutdowns of the U.S. government.

item.title: Supreme Court pauses order that Trump administration must pay full SNAP benefits
item.description: The Trump administration tried not to pay for any food stamps in November because of the government shutdown. It now proposes partial SNAP benefits.

item.title: Shutdown starting to ‘bite the economy,’ Trump aide warns, with no deal apparent
As stocks wobbled, the S&P 500 held this critical threshold. What comes next?
